intro: Calandrinia remota, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its succulent leaves and deep root system help it conserve water efficiently.
